comments.body: Yo tengo una idea para minecraft y seria muchísimo mejor si añadirán mas jefes por ejemplo uno en el nether o mas dimensiones
Craft 1.17 Roberta
/team

It could fall over, its soul lights would flicker, and then just blow up in the typical Minecraft boss fashion.

You're right killing a Warden deserves much more than disappearing in a cloud of smoke.

Hadopelagic Rainbow, for the millionth time the Warden is not a boss, and it's not meant to be a challenge to kill, it's meant to be almost impossible to kill so that players will need to find strategies that allow them to stealth around it and avoid a horrific death while trying to loot the Deep Dark and the structures inside it. According to Kingbdogz, the Deep Dark wouldn't look even remotely like what we've seen in Minecraft Live, so the entire experience and gameplay would be a lot more immersive and fun than how I've described it here. I still do agree though that it would be a very nice touch to give the Warden a unique death scene. After all a unique mob like that deserves a death scene that fits with its theme and design, and even if it wouldn't normally die in legit Survival, it will really contribute to the lore and polish of the mob.
good idea

Ziad El-Moursy, Oh boy, Is there anywhere that I can make suggestions for the Deep Dark? Also, I didn't mean to call the Warden a boss, I just found it funny that other mobs with special death animations explode. And If it is supposed to be impossible to kill, what kind of rewards would it drop. I am thinking at least a trophy.

I think that this is a great idea, not only because, well, it's the warden and its got so much potential, but also because many people want a trophy for killing this guy and Mojang doesn't seem to want this to be a boss mob, and this could be a little reward without giving a dedicated reason for everyone to want to kill it.

While the debug screen exists, this may be a waste of resources. However, I like the idea of gadgetry like this, and wish to see them find some way to make it work.

Maybe if it also gave you some idea of what ores could be found on a given layer?
Was just going to suggest this myself. Needs to be done. Perhaps quartz should be used in the recipe. Would be a good addition to the caves and cliffs update.
Could be called a Depth Gauge

I wanted this so much and complements the compass. Additional functionality is that if it is used on a Lodestone, the Depth Gauge will now point if you are at the same height level as the Lodestone.

What I picture it looks like is that the gadget looks similar to a clock that has a pointer that either has its range in a 180 degree angle arc, with 180 as the highest point, 90 as the sea level, and 0 as the lowest point, or in a vertical level gauge with similar parameters. If it is used on a Lodestone, the middle point indicates you are at the same height level.
Thats a very good addition to the game
Yeah, that would be cool
Is this a new gym stone or what

Limestone contains calcite and aragonite. It's all calcium carbonate.
Make calcite spawn with these rules, and make it craftable into white dye.
Maybe no mobs with armors and wepons but instead more chalanging versions od existing ones.
wrong category but yes
This is the right category. /gamerule Playersleepingpercentage is being released in 1.17, therefore, it belongs in this category.
If any moderator sees this message, please tell Mojang that if they want to have parity, they could make it a lot easier on themselves by not adding any more version-exclusive features.
I thank you if you vote on this topic, it would be very supportive, and it would benefit all players : )
So basically just increase the Nether's depth and add Cave Generation and Brutes? No, a Nether Cave Update would have to be so much more, some biomes, new ores, etc. This simply has too little scope

The nether does need a cave overhaul like the overworld. Could even add some crazy mountains using nether biomes in lava lakes maybe? Could use the strider to get to them. Caves could be abandoned by piglins which I think someone mentioned which I think is a good idea. Some parts could look like they were tnt mined which would be cool. Could have Redstone left in places from them using it to set off tnt. Could have a broken portal that goes to an abandon mineshaft in the overworld. The portal in the overworld in the mineshaft could be different in some way. My idea comes from the idea that they mined for netherite and went back and forth between the mineshafts in the overworld. Could have sand pockets near the portal.

If the windchime instead drew in mobs could be a handy feature for mob farms and sort of an ironic counter to all the moans and growls. I do like the idea of tinted panes for sure for builds, I'm not much a redstone person but the randomizer does sound fun.
yes clouds are totally too low, even without the new build limit

Having clouds such as Cumulonimbus, Cumulus, Stratus, etc, Clouds at differing Sizes and Altitudes would really up the Scenic Value of Mountains by a lot. Maybe it would be simpler to just have two levels of clouds, one at 220 as you said, but maybe another layer at 280 or something along those lines.
I'd like to see up to 50 in an infested deepslate vein, the silverfish have twice the health and attack, and they come out much quicker (up to 10 at once)
Maybe the endermite
this sounds like a great idea! right now silverfish aren't even that challenging so having them randomly pop out in caves could be fun!
Perhaps this should be more present everywhere below 0 instead of exclusively in mountain biomes.
Maybe infested deepslate generates slightly more often in slightly bigger groups! Still don't think silverfish are meant to be anything more than an annoyance.
I feel like the infested blocks aren't common enough too...
True

I would be fine with copper being purely cosmetic if there was another new (and more useful) ore to hunt for. But if copper is all that's being added, it needs to be much more useful if it wants to tempt players to spend more time underground.

Yea, like it doesn't have to be an armor set or weapon set, but could possible help in other ways. like maybe adding a copper block to an armor could make it where you move slightly faster the more you move around.

I feel like it suffers most from the fact that the game's basic metal tools and systems are basically already there and use Iron or Gold. Copper Pipes? Well, we have Iron Hoppers. Blast Furnaces already exist, Smokers already exist, rails already exist. Etc.

I think this is a case where either they need to change old recipes to incorporate Copper, like Powered Rails, or come up with a cheaper and only slightly different alternative to existing assets, like a scaffolding block, a faster minecart or a new hopper type, instead of waiting to come up with something completely new and niche. Same goes for Amethyst. My take is that they should look at making old recipes use it, too, like replacing Glass used to craft End Crystals for instance.

Melly Dow, notice that cauldrons are getting loads more useful in Caves & Cliffs. You will be able to use them to get Powdered Snow as well as renewable lava using Pointed Dripstone. As for Copper, it is still very early in development. Building uses are actually a huge part of Minecraft, and Copper is really unique when it comes to building. Besides, they seem to have a lot of plans for it. For instance, the Brushes we've seen during the Archaeology video in Minecraft Live seemed to be made out of Copper. Copper seems to have a significant historical factor due to how it weathers and its possible relationship to archaeology, and I definitely like that design. It will definitely be a more themed, useful and integrated building mineral than Quartz. There are still a lot of things we don't know about when it comes to Copper and its uses, we just need to be patient.

Ziad El-Moursy, I think quartz is a good thing to compare it to, quartz seems pretty good balance wise, it can be obtained plentifully for building via trading but miust e mined for crafting redstone components (and the observer is a frequently udsed component)
I think that if all copper makes is the spyglass, lightning rod, and possibly archeology brushes, that it is likley that you will only bother to collect about 1 stack in a world unless you specifically want to build with it and currently to do anything large scale it doesnt even seem very realistic to build anything big with only being able to mine it.
Perhaps they will make it common to find copper blocks of various weatheredness from archeology that might help.
The big thing is that extrinsicly motivated players will see copper as a pointless addition unless it gets more important uses.

It definitely could become more desirable than it is now. I think that if the Spyglass is given more functionality and if Archaeology is truly interesting so that you want to keep continuously doing it, Copper could be even much more relevant than Quartz.

"some real thought to weather copper is good"

Weather... haha good one!

well, actually you sholdn't be worried for copper because mojang is amazing and will find all cool methods to use copper. What I am worried about is the mod compatibility as many tech mods have copper implemented
I suggest that they should also be able to be powered and propel minecarts.

yeah they should definitly add rubies or a least some new ore

it would be disappointing if we got a cave update and only one new ore
we dont need anymore ores right now imo
I say add mythril ore. And give it unique uses besides tools. Idk how to balance it relitive to netherrite and diamond tho.
I think there should be more armor like stone and stuff

Yes! And more generally, I think they should generate more irregularly. So instead of small dots of lichen scattered everywhere, there should be clusters and large patches at some places and nothing at others. This would bring even more variety in caves: some would be almost bright, others very dark.
Yeah, especially with how big and dark caves can be now.
yeah it should be in bigger clumps because the caves are too dark
Absolutely agree. Caves are just too dark right now. It could generate in long vertical strips and make caves look even taller.
I agree the caves are so dark now especially high up in them
Well Hoes are the proper tool for Sculk Sensors, so the same will probably happen for the other Sculk Stuff and yea the proper tool for Moss should the Hoe not the Axe
Or pretty much any non-woody/hard plant block would be good.
i love it good idea
Makes sense. Voted.
(Potion of Levitation)
I think a potion that makes you completely silent would be a cool addition. Something like "Potion of Deafening" or "Potion of Stealth". It would go very well with invisibility.
I think this would be good if it required a lingering potion, because if you are to sneak past the Warden, you should be late/post game.

I thought of this earlier, but never actually got to post it

I agree with your ideas for uses, but I think that it should drip Veeery slowly
The item you get should be called obsidian tears or something
Hm... perhaps it fills the cauldron with purple liquid, and using a bottle gives you Dragon Breath, perhaps?
I think this will fit in an end update.
This would be great for end-busting.
how are you suposed to zoom in the scope on the crossbow
I really like the concept. I know that the idea says otherwise but maybe there could be a way to get this glowing water and it would only have this effect within a certain radius of regular water.
GREAT IDEA! :D
Or a spin on this same idea: vampires? You could implement them among bats and would fly down and transform from a bat to a vampire to try and poison you, but would once again burn in daylight.
Good idea and the globin can trade with you
I think this would be awesome, goblin villagers/miners that live in cavern villages and you can trade with them.

I’d love to see Goblins in Minecraft as well!

But instead of caves, I was thinking they could be on the mountains. With the new generated world in 1.18, while it’s cool to have those tall mountains, it needs something to explore as well.

Some ideas:
- A goblin hut in the mountains
- Goblin caves (consider these not as caves, but a new generated structure, a unique cave that these Goblins made in the mountains) that the Goblins live in.
- Goblin definitely needs different types
- Some of them ride goats!
can you add this mob to the game pz.

I would love to see goblin caves. It would change from the usual cave mobs like zombies, creepers, skeletons... We need something new, strange and scary, but not too dangerous like the Warden. You could trade with them if you have gold (more affordable than emeralds if you're early in the game, and they'd give you different items than the piglins), but goblins would attack you if you got really precious stuff on you, like emeralds or diamond.
Goblin caves could be located in high mountains, and goblins would go out at night to attack any passive mob. If the player kills the goblins they would respawn overtime, but they would stop spawning in the area if the player destroys the goblin spawner hidden in the goblin cave.
Some larger goblin caves would be less likely to spawn, but would go far underground with stronger goblins with special armors, wizard goblins and a goblin king boss

fun fact amethyst actually is a purple quartz, the purple color comes from iron impurities. there's actually a lot of gems that are just different colors of quartz, like citrine and smoky quartz(duh).

but about your post I agree a "smooth" version of amethyst just like nether quartz blocks would look cool, more color options are great in general :)
Instead of making this super complicated, let's just smelt amethyst blocks in a furnace and get smooth amethyst.
Shields already can my guy
I personaly think this would be awesome! but a disadvantage is that mobs could be made to see you better depending on the amount of light your armor emits

They wouldn't be able to give off light thanks to the limitations of the lighting engine, but I'd really like this idea to be implemented. They could still have a glow in the dark effect, like Enderman eyes or the new dyed signs. It could be useful for seeing people in the dark in multiplayer, or keeping track of a mob like a zombie.
I think this idea would be awesome! Because of the lighting engine the stuff would kinda just be neon and I think it would be best just for looks tbh.
I thought that I made that up,🤔🤷‍♂️
Si el océano es muuuuy plano
Excitement! Danger! What better than waves on the ocean to describe that!? Also the water is too calm. I’m up for more excitement on the seven seas!
This post got deleted at 16 votes for some reason :/
Nice idea

I should also point out that copper minecarts exist in real life, they are very old, so the fact that they are old would add on to the reason to add them to the game with the deteriorating oxidization feature, which could also be waxed to keep in its desired state.
The problem is, copper is about as easy to find, if not easier than iron, so there would need to be a benefit to iron minecarts too.
You could also adjust the speed with the oxidation! I think it would be really cool to have to wax the minecart at the speed you'd like.

FINALLY, someone that care about wandering traders. The idea is wonderful except for the part where you put animals in the bag, it's called animal abuse, I suggest you to delete that part from the idea and replace it with something else
Thanks for letting me know, i just changed it where he will lead those animals instead of putting them in bundles.
I'm not sure how it would look in a GUI, but if you do trade the Llamas, their leads should just attach to you and they should immediately become loyal
Stop kill Wandering Trader!
The loot should be randomized, the only way you can know the prize is the cost.
